111.content:
As long as she could remember, Milly had always been a tiny fox, as were her whole family. She was adamant that they were the only tiny furries anywhere, as she hadn't seen nor heard of any other miniscule species before.

Many years ago, the quarter-inch tall fox had lost her family when she slept, tired from her ventures in the house that they had occupied under the floorboards. With no idea what had happened to them, Milly had to fend for herself, to survive for herself. At the age of 18, it was incredible how mature she was. The harsh reality of her world forced her to be so, just gathering food for herself was a dangerous feat.

The house she lived in sure didn't belong to her, but to a female huskey of "normal" height. Of course, height was relative to Milly as the huskey was hundreds of feet tall from her point-of-view. Bella, she was called.

Bella was a Syberian Huskey, 26 years of age. As far as Milly could tell from living in her house, hidden in plain sight, Bella was a student, but of what she was not sure. Milly did her best to stay away from her, only coming out of living space whenever Bella was out of the house and only then would she go looking for supplies to keep her living. It was a shallow life to some, but the basics of nature is to survive, after all. And this was her life.

When Bella was in the house, Milly would be resting under the floorboards in the living room that was thankfully the room next to the kitchen. Small bits of food and crumbs could be found everywhere here, and if it happened to be that Bella had cleaned her house, it wasn't far for Milly to venture to go to the kitchen.

Life under the floorboards was no fun though. Whenever Bella or her friends walked around, the thought that the were mere feet above her scared Milly to the core. When Milly was younger, she sometimes had nightmares of a giant paw falling through the ceiling just above her, crushing her into nothing but bloody matter. However, as she grew older, her fear subsided and it was nothing more than everyday reality to her, something she just dealed with on a day-to-day basis.

Milly had always wondered what would happen if she had revealed herself to Bella, but just the shear sight of the giant dog was too much to bare and it was better to be safe than sorry especially for a fox who was as small as she was. But there were times when she observed the giant hound, that she would become jealous the simple things. Clothes were one such example. Milly was fine in her natural orange and white fur, with the hot water pipes only mere inches away from her in the floor keeping her warm, but she thought that it would be nice to be able to dress up once in a while. Being able to have a wash whever you wanted would be nice too. But life went on for Milly and she was never bitter about her situation.

--- --- ---

Milly had waited under the floor, her usual 30 minute wait to make sure the silence she heard meant that Bella had left the house confirmed she was alone. It was early afternoon, and it was time for her rounds to find food.

As she made her way to the surface of the living room through the small cracks between the boards, she hoped for what she might find. I'm sure I could smell bacon cooking earlier... Milly thought to herself. She had been living on bits of cheese and bread for the past couple of weeks. She hoped one day she could have a choice in what she had to eat, somehow, someway.

She crawled onto the laminate floorboard and began to make her way to the kitchen, an easy 10 minute walk for her, but she liked to have a run and get her exercise, it was a cramped life under the floor so why not. As she ran for the kitchen, she scanned the living room for any bits of food, anything she could grab to keep her going.

And to her luck, she spotted some bread in the direction she was heading. And she could smell bacon too! Maybe, just maybe, there may be a small slither of meat for her to nibble on. As she closed in on the bread, the smell of bacon became stronger. And it wasn't long until her paws began to stick to the floor. Before she could wonder what it was her feet were sticking to, she slipped and tripped with a splat on her back, her fur and tail instantly becoming stuck to the...

"Grease... Oh God...!" Milly yelped. It was grease that must've dripped from Bella's sandwhich! She had never had a problem like this before, this was a new situation. She was glued to the floor, in the middle of the living room of the giant female huskey...

Drax had been picking on him all week, all month and pretty much the entirety of his school career, even going as far back as the first couple of years at nuresry. They had known each other for so long. Been friends, fallen out and become enemies, tastes and likes changed and they've become further and further apart as they were getting into their mid-teens. Ben had only gotten out of that mess simply because an older, bigger student had walked in on them, and Drax immediately backed off, smirking as he left Ben a whimpering mess.

"Look, we've just gotta do this experiment and then it's our lunch break and we won't have to see him til Monday."

Ben nodded, frustrated that Drax had yet another laugh at his expense, it must've been the tenth time this week at least. Thank God it was Friday, Ben thought to himself with a huff. He grabbed a beaker himself and and a few of the chemicals they were using today and Beth got the rest, both of them ignoring Drax's attention seeking banter he was offering the rest of the class, whether they wanted it or not.

Ben didn't really care what they were making, he just followed Beth's instructions, and every now and then getting a jab from Drax from across the room and Ben radiating his hate.

At the end of the lesson, Ben learned nothing but the fact he hated Drax even more, especially when he wolf whistled at Beth before she turned to leave the room with Ben following close behind. They had almost made it to the canteen before...

"Aww crap, I left my homework planner in the classroom..."

"I'll go and get it," Ben muttered. "I think I left mine in there too." He quickly thought up an excuse. He really liked his friend and had done for a long time, and he would often find excuses to do things for her. Beth, was clueless to Ben's liking for her and continued her life in bliss, or so it seemed to Ben. He always wondered whether she liked him too, but Ben was too shy to ask or ever to bring it up. There had been many oppurtunities, but finiding the courage in him to ask or say anything at all was too much. So, he turned and sulked back to the science labs.

He walked through the door and saw Beth's diary on the desk. He walked to the desk and picked up the diary, just when his arm started to sting where the contents of the beaker had splashed on him. And then, eveything grew larger all around him, even his clothes and backpack...

Jenna awoke with a jump.

She lay on her bed, still slightly drunk from the night out with her colleagues having celebrated her friends promotion in the city. For some reason, her heart was beating a bit more rapidly than normal. Maybe, she thought, that she had a nightmare that snapped her from her slumber. Or maybe even someone had slammed a door somewhere down the corridor. The joys of living in an apartment building on a Friday night in the city, it was hard to get a moments peace.

The apartment. Her apartment. She was confused, how the hell did she even get back here? She lived on the 24th floor of this high-towering sky-scraper and she was positive she was far too drunk to make it here herself. She lazily wafted her arm around the bed, but she was definitely alone.

She slowly parted one of her eyelids and glanced at her clock on her bedside table, struggling to focus on the illuminated display.

05:18

The dark red numbers glared at her in the dark.

"Ugh..." she groaned. The 27 year old woman stretched in her bed and sighed. She could feel the hangover creeping on her already, her head lightly throbbing and her mouth dry, her throat coarse. She hated smoking and she instantly regretted her social smoking, as per usual whenever it was the day after having a night out. Even though the thought of getting out of bed right now was painful but the on-coming storm of a horrible hangover loomed and so Jenna forced herself to stagger from her bed.

As she stood on her hardwood floor, her long oak-brown hair cascaded down her naked back. As she took her first step, she stumbled slightly and just managed to keep her balance. With her next step, Jenna pointed herself in the direction of her en-suite bathroom and walked slowly to the door. It was a pain having such a large bedroom at this state, she just wanted a glass of water in an instant but instead it felt like an Earth-age to get there. But before she knew it, her hand gripped the handle and swung the door open and pulled on the light chord and suddenly she was blinded.

Jenna groaned again from the bright light, squinting and almost blindedly reached for the cabinet above the sink and pulled out her pain killers and a small glass. Shutting the cabinet door, she looked at her face reflecting back at her in the small bathroom. She looked a state, but she was still beautiful nevertheless.

Filling her glass of cold water, she popped a couple of tablets into her mouth and took a swig from her glass and swallowed. Jenna accepted that this wasn't going to be her first tablets for the day and it was a good thing she wasn't working later. She yawned and filled her glass again.

As she turned off her tap, a rumble of thunder in the distance theatened her already-throbbing head.

"Great," she muttered to herself. "Just what I need."

The light flickered but Jenna hardly noticed as she pulled on the chord and closed the door, walking back to her bed with the glass of water in hand.

Another rumble, but sounding closer this time.

"Oh go away for fuc-" before Jenna could finish her sentance, an impossible blinding light shone through her big black curtains, which were thick for good reason, and her whole apartment basked for only a moment in this light before fading to darkness. A shattering boom near blew open her head, making her ears shriek with pain and it shook her whole world with Jenna falling face forward with a scream and dropping her glass that smashed as it hit the floor.

"Holy shit! What the fuck was that?!" For a moment, she thought that maybe it had been an earthquake, but she knew full well that earthquake don't produce a bright light and a boom like the one that had nearly sent her completely deaf.

And then there was nothing. Nothing but rain beginning to patter against her windows.

She was shaking in the dark, paralysed on the floor in shock and slight fear. Jenna waited for another rumble from the storm, but nothing came. Nothing but...

"What... What is happening out there?" she thought. She could just hear what she thought like screaming. And car alarms whailing and even horns beeping way below on the city streets. And then there was more commotion, more panicking noises.

She slowly forced herself onto her feet and treaded carefully to her wall-to-wall window, and slowly, she pulled the curtain away. There was nothing there but the city that could be seen from her living space, the countless lights twinkling in the dark night sky, the rain on the window giving it a look of water-painted beauty. Curiously, she opened the curtain more so that she could look down the city on her left and all seemed fine. But what she couldn't really see was that far below, people were running in panic in the direction she was looking.

She frowned, confused as she could still hear the panic below, but as she turned her head to the right and looked at what finally was causing the commotion, her heart was in her throat and she was turning white very quickly, feeling her legs begin to shake...

"No, no it... Can't be...!"

Jenna backed away from her window and in an instant she slammed them shut again. Her heartbeat was booming in her ears now, her throat felt like it was swelling and her breathing became erratic from the shear shock that had just washed over her in an instant from the sight of the...

"How is this possible...?! It.." But no matter how much Jenna tried to re-assure herself, there was no way that she oculd lie to herself of such an impossible truth.

She stood frozen on the spot for moments longer than she knew, balancing herself on the balls of her feet. But if she could see it, and everyone else could see it then surely...

She snapped from her funk and dashed to her TV that was mounted to the wall and quickly turned it on. In the few seconds that it took for the screen to come on, more panic could be heard not only from the city below, but from the rest of the occupants in her building. She could hear her neighbours beginning to scream and run wild along the corridors just outside her own door.

When the screen flicked on, nothing but black and white noise was brightly shining at her. She picked up her remote and tried to flick through the channels, looking for some kind of news but none came. Nothing, but signal noise. In panic, she dashed for her phone on her bedside table, but she quickly found that there was no signal, no way of communicating to and from the outside.

She sat frozen, staring at the animated pond water animated wallpaper on her phone, wondering what to do. What could she do? What could anybody do? She glanced back to her clock that had caught her eye in the light from the TV and quickly fiddled with the knobs and switched the radio on.

A distorted woman's voice that sounded that it had been recorded in the fifties quietly spoke through the mono speaker. "...gency transmission. This is an emergency transmission. This is an-"

"OH FOR FUCKS SAKE!" She screamed at the radio, slowly beginning to weep in sheer fear and panic like nothing she had ever felt before. Holding her hands on her lap, she listened to the repeated message over and over again hoping that another voice would interrupt the woman's recording but after a few minutes, the message was still repeating in the gloom.

This had given time for Jenna to think about what she had seen. Was she going crazy? Had someone drugged her? But it couldn't be drugs, surely, that could make such a vivid reality around her so extreme.

How could something be so gigatnic, how could it be physically possible? As she pondered and pondered, sobbing as she did, she came to wonder why...

Why hadn't it moved yet? Surely she would have felt it, seen it move...

Was she even sure she saw what she saw? Jenna's eyes locked onto the curtains that she had hastily closed. She wanted another look, another reason to doubt her sanity.

Slowly getting back to her feet, she made her way to the window with the laminated floor creaking under her feet. Gripping onto the curtain again, she breathed heavily and slowly with her heart still racing in her throat. She closed her eyes and opened the curtains, and hesitated.

Turning her head, Jenna opened them again and saw what she hoped wasn't still there, lingering in the darkness. She pressed her naked body to the cold glass, pushing the side of her face to see if she could get a better look from her window. This was probably the only time that she damned the fact that her windows didn't open. But still, she did indeed get a better look.

155111.content:
Jenna looks out the window to see a giant, humanoid shaped creature walking down the street. The giant’s face is invisible to her, because it is wearing a silver colored, science fiction looking spacesuit, and helmet. Behind the astronaut looking giant is a mountain size spacecraft that has landed on part of the city. Fires are blazing behind the giant, and there appear to be other giants as well behind it, working on the spacecraft. She could also see fighter jets, tanks, helicopters, and ground troops firing on the approaching giant, and on the mother ship. However, nothing is getting through. All of these creatures and the mother ship seem to be protected by some kind of energy shield. The shield is allowing slower moving objects to pass through like people who are fleeing the battle zone, but it is stopping vehicles, and any projectiles from hitting these giant alien creatures.

She could also see that the giants seem to be making every effort to avoid stepping on the fleeing civilians, and they are not retaliating against the tiny human military forces. She also hears on the radio, “Reports are coming in that many of the people from the destroyed section of the city have suddenly reappeared in a nearby city, unharmed.” However, the military continues its fruitless assault on these aliens. She watches as the giant, space suited creature carefully walks towards her building, and its black tinted face is pointed in her direction. She notices it is carrying an empty see through, hamster like cage, big enough for several humans.

At the same time, on a floor above hers, Alex has just gotten out of the shower. The 29-year-old male model/actor is drying himself off, when he hears rumbling, and explosions outside. Curious, the blue eyed, brown haired, single, Caucasian hunk wraps a towel around his bare waist, and looks outside. He sees a giant spaceman walking towards his building, and he slaps his smooth, clean-shaven face to make sure he is not dreaming. He still does not wake-up, and out of a sense of shock, he drops his towel and leans his naked body against the window as well.

In an apartment below Jenna’s, two naive, but extremely attractive naked White teenagers are making love. Emily is currently in her bed, resting on her back, with her longtime boyfriend Eric riding her on top. Emily’s parents are away for a few days, so she invited her boyfriend over. Wanting to experiment a bit, the two attractive science fiction nuts are making love with the lights on. The 16-year-old couple is going at it, when they see the huge UFO landing on the other half of the city. They are about to stop, when they decide that they are about to die anyways, so they might as well die making love to each other. As they hump each other, they see a giant spaceman walking towards them, and get excited. Emily asks, “Do you think he, she, it sees us?”

“I hope so, maybe he wants us for his zoo, or as living dolls,” Eric responds.

The naked young blonde haired couple get up, run over to the curtain less window as it approaches. Still standing, Emily bends over while Eric does her vaginally from behind. Meanwhile, the 150 foot tall spaceman who is walking towards the building thought the scavenger hunt the others sent him on was going to be fruitless. The others wanted to get rid of him, so they told him to go collect some living human specimens for study. The only catch, the humans have to be nearly, or completely naked. He knew from the reports that he read that humans nearly always wore clothes. Imagine his surprise when he saw a healthy looking, tiny female standing in the window naked looking at him. He also saw a healthy looking, tiny naked male, in the floor above hers looking at him too. Then he saw a younger naked couple making love in the window below the lone female.” Jackpot,” he thought to himself. “At least two breeding pairs of humans found.”

With little effort, the giant who we will call Henry gently smashes through the two window and abducts the Jenna and Alex. The two tiny naked human specimens are fearful but unharmed. He then reaches his hand into the lower apartment. The window is wide open, and he can tell that the young couple is climaxing together as he gently grabs the tiny nude couple. The couple is now finished as they are placed inside the giant hamster cage with the other two. Henry continues to look inside each window, hoping to see another healthy looking, tiny naked person to add to his collection. Henry, the giant anthro…
155111.title: Jenna the tiny specimen.

15512.content:
Jenny Parkinson taught history at Bromfield Community College. She was a brunette in her late thirties, 5'5" with hazel eyes. Last year she had faced the rather bothersome situation of a divorce, which left her with three children. However her eldest daughter, Alice, had left home to study a graduation course. The bad news was that her son, Michael, was the bad apple who was starting the upcoming school year as one of her students, which would give him the misplaced belief that he could get away with murder... metaphorically speaking. As to her other daughter, Carol, she was quite well-behaved both in terms of being the youngest of her kids and in terms of being a preteen.

Jenny had spent a well-earned break over the summer at the seaside while Alice kept the home and her ex had the opportunity to care for the other two. Being something of an amateur archaeologist she had spent some of the daytime digging and scraping about the beaches and sea cliffs when she happened upon a most mysterious artifact, a whistle apparently carved from a stag's antler. In her leisure hours after returning home she cleaned and buffed this item and found an inscription upon it... Iere avertentem et gelu. She took the opportunity to pass on a copy of this to a colleague who had a rudimentary knowledge of Latin who provided a translation of They went, misleading the frost.

Eventually the school term started. Her classes were somewhat rowdy but bearable in the initial weeks, but after a month had passed she then found herself walking into a scene of total anarchy. She strained to keep the class under control but her son kept stoking the fire of discord, whereupon she remembered having the self-same whistle in her jacket. Pulling it out she prepared to silence the mob with a blow that would surely be taken in the manner of a whistle signaling the end of a break. She looked upon the whole class, put the whistle to her lips, and blew.

She was shocked by what she witnessed while she blew. Before her very eyes all the students in her class, everything they wore or were physically carrying at the time, shrank away so fast that, by the time she stopped blowing, she could barely see them. She was now transfixed as she looked between her find and the now deceptively empty classroom. What had she found?
15512.title: STORY START: Whistle 'n' Dwindle

15521.content:
Andre felt the rain and cold in the air, the soaking wet clothes sticking to his skinand streams of fresh rain water poured off his skin. He was not in the most ideal of conditions, as he was lost, tired and hungry. The mountain slope had been unkind to him, falling and tumbling into the valley, losing all his possesions and items in the process. He had no means to survive, no ways of communicating with anyone nad he certainly did not know a way out of the valley forest he was in. Andre felt hopeless.

Sitting down on a log, he rested his head in is hands and sighed heavily. "I may as well just give up." He had planned the trip to be simple, yet fun filled camping trip. His life had become boring and dull and he needed adventure. Packing up a weeks worth of supplies and food, he traveled out in search of something yet he didn't know what, he just wanted an adventure. Now it seemed to be all so hopeless. Endless cracks of thunder and lightning shook the skies and the rain came down even harder.

KTHUMP!

Andre's eyes opened widerthan he could open them. The large massive boom he had heard and felt did not come from the sky, but in fact from something hitting the ground. UPDATES
--- --- ---

20/04/15 - Added a few choice chapters and added a few chapters myself of course. Enjoy!

22/02/15 - Done some cleaning up in the chapters, and I've also put STORY START: on the beginning chapters of all the stories, so it's easier to navigate and see where the stories chain up when you're looking at the chapter list. Enjoy!

16/02/15 - Been a busy year, but I'm going to start adding chapters on a regular basis, as such I've uploaded a few chapters just within the last couple of weeks. As well as a title change, the story is back!

05/02/14 - This was primarily a furry story, but I have now added choices for human stories an/or a mix between the two. I have therefore changed the title of this story.

28/12/13 - I have finished creating all the story choices, and there is a lot!

*I'll fill this out soon in more detail*

Please enjoy this size-changing epic. I wanted to start this to create a universe with furries and/or humans of all sizes.

Rules

The reason I add such rules is because when I read other stories, they are usually full of inconsistencies and endless options. I would like to make this piece of work something that a reader can jump into and immediately become engrossed in the story. So, please follow these simple rules and let's make something great!

- Please keep the writing in third-person.

- If you wish to add to the story, please keep your chapters at least 1000 characters long. If they are short and doesn't add anything to the story I will either edit or delete your chapter. If you want to create more options for the reader, please clearly explain their choices.

- Do not add chapter-after-chapter with yet more choices or "options" as this goes on forever and adds nothing to the story and I will delete them accordingly.

- If you are wanting to start a new story, then make a new story using one of the "intro-options". Do not give readers endless options as to what character they want to be/read. Just start your story and go from there.

- No blood/gore and bodily waste
- No deaths.
